result.markdown:
# Preface {.unnumbered}

This web-resource contains code that was touched upon during class. 

## Necessary packages


::: {.cell}

:::


If you do not have these installed ("Could not find package xyz") you need to 
install the package. 


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# load necessary packages
# data preparation
library(readr)
library(tibble)
library(dplyr)

# visualization
library(ggplot2)

# missings
library(naniar)

# tables
library(kableExtra)
```
:::


## Import dataset

- By storing it into an object with the `zz_`-prefix, you can easier modify it 
  afterwards without re-importing


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# import the dataset using the {readr}-package
zz_dataset <- read_csv("data/2023-02-20_QoC_sample_dataset.csv", 
                       show_col_types = FALSE)
```
:::



## Check the import

By looking at the top five rows (the "head" of the dataset): 


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
head(zz_dataset, n = 5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 5 × 6
  patient_ids sex   unit   adm          los disch     
        <dbl> <chr> <chr>  <date>     <dbl> <date>    
1       13679 f     ward_B 2022-01-27    10 2022-02-06
2       15231 f     ward_A 2022-01-16     3 2022-01-19
3       10758 f     ward_A 2022-01-10    18 2022-01-28
4       10319 m     ward_B 2022-01-20     7 2022-01-27
5       17826 m     ward_A 2022-01-26     5 2022-01-31
```
:::
:::


- Seems the input worked as expected :relieved:
- the columns 'sex' and 'unit' should be a factor, not a character


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# change 'sex' into factor
dataset <- 
  zz_dataset %>% 
  mutate(sex = as.factor(sex), 
         unit = as.factor(unit))
```
:::



... then again check the top five rows:



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
head(dataset, n = 5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 5 × 6
  patient_ids sex   unit   adm          los disch     
        <dbl> <fct> <fct>  <date>     <dbl> <date>    
1       13679 f     ward_B 2022-01-27    10 2022-02-06
2       15231 f     ward_A 2022-01-16     3 2022-01-19
3       10758 f     ward_A 2022-01-10    18 2022-01-28
4       10319 m     ward_B 2022-01-20     7 2022-01-27
5       17826 m     ward_A 2022-01-26     5 2022-01-31
```
:::
:::
